page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW.
page.content: This rural area is mainly farmland and very flat.Many of the houses are old and made of stone with slate roofs. There are some very picturesque thatched cottages. A few main roads run through but most are narrow country lanes. Dairy farming is predominant and therefore the fields are used mainly for hay or silage making and for grazing. Some crops are grown such as barley and wheat. The people live in four communities. The smallest is Adber consisting of farms and cottages. Ashington has a fine manor house and interesting church. Chilton Cantelo is noted for its private school and mysterious skull and headless body. Marston Magna is the biggest and can boast of a village post office, two public houses manor house, church, winery, and the unusual moat field.
